docs.title: FSL
docs.description:
FSL is a comprehensive library of analysis tools for FMRI, MRI and diffusion brain imaging data. It runs on macOS (Intel and M1/M2/M3), Linux, and Windows via the Windows Subsystem for Linux, and is very easy to install. Most of the tools can be run both from the command line and as GUIs ("point-and-click" graphical user interfaces). To quote the relevant references for FSL tools you should look in the individual tools' manual pages, and also please reference one or more of the FSL overview papers:

M.W. Woolrich, S. Jbabdi, B. Patenaude, M. Chappell, S. Makni, T. Behrens, C. Beckmann, M. Jenkinson, S.M. Smith. Bayesian analysis of neuroimaging data in FSL. NeuroImage, 45:S173-86, 2009

S.M. Smith, M. Jenkinson, M.W. Woolrich, C.F. Beckmann, T.E.J. Behrens, H. Johansen-Berg, P.R. Bannister, M. De Luca, I. Drobnjak, D.E. Flitney, R. Niazy, J. Saunders, J. Vickers, Y. Zhang, N. De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-19, 2004

M. Jenkinson, C.F. Beckmann, T.E. Behrens, M.W. Woolrich, S.M. Smith. FSL. NeuroImage, 62:782-90, 2012

docs.title: Output File
docs.description: The main output file produced by fslmaths
FSL utility for image arithmetic, statistics, and mathematical operations
authors: FMRIB Analysis Group, University of Oxford

docs.title: Internal datatype
docs.description: Datatype used internally for calculations

docs.title: Input images
docs.description: Input images for processing
Operations to perform on input images

docs.title: Add
docs.description: Add following input to current image

docs.title: Subtract
docs.description: Subtract following input from current image

docs.title: Multiply
docs.description: Multiply current image by following input

docs.title: Divide
docs.description: Divide current image by following input

docs.title: Modulus remainder
docs.description: Modulus remainder - divide current image by following input and take remainder

docs.title: Mask
docs.description: Use (following image>0) to mask current image

docs.title: Threshold
docs.description: Use following number to threshold current image (zero anything below the number)

docs.title: Threshold percentage
docs.description: Use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE to threshold current image (zero anything below the number)

docs.title: Threshold percentage of non-zero voxels
docs.description: Use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE of non-zero voxels and threshold below

docs.title: Upper threshold
docs.description: Use following number to upper-threshold current image (zero anything above the number)

docs.title: Upper threshold percentage
docs.description: Use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE to upper-threshold current image (zero anything above the number)

docs.title: Upper threshold percentage of non-zero voxels
docs.description: Use following percentage (0-100) of ROBUST RANGE of non-zero voxels and threshold above

docs.title: Maximum
docs.description: Take maximum of following input and current image

docs.title: Minimum
docs.description: Take minimum of following input and current image

docs.title: Seed
docs.description: Seed random number generator with following number

docs.title: Restart
docs.description: Replace the current image with input for future processing operations

docs.title: Save
docs.description: Save the current working image to the input filename

docs.title: Exponential
docs.description: Exponential

docs.title: Natural logarithm
docs.description: Natural logarithm

docs.title: Sine
docs.description: Sine function

docs.title: Cosine
docs.description: Cosine function

docs.title: Tangent
docs.description: Tangent function

docs.title: Arc sine
docs.description: Arc sine function

docs.title: Arc cosine
docs.description: Arc cosine function

docs.title: Arc tangent
docs.description: Arc tangent function

docs.title: Square
docs.description: Square

docs.title: Square root
docs.description: Square root

docs.title: Reciprocal
docs.description: Reciprocal (1/current image)

docs.title: Absolute value
docs.description: Absolute value

docs.title: Binarise
docs.description: Use (current image>0) to binarise

docs.title: Binarise and invert
docs.description: Binarise and invert (binarisation and logical inversion)

docs.title: Fill holes
docs.description: Fill holes in a binary mask (holes are internal - i.e. do not touch the edge of the FOV)

docs.title: Fill holes using 26 connectivity
docs.description: Fill holes using 26 connectivity

docs.title: Index
docs.description: Replace each nonzero voxel with a unique (subject to wrapping) index number

docs.title: Grid
docs.description: Add a 3D grid of intensity <value> with grid spacing <spacing>

docs.title: Edge strength
docs.description: Edge strength

docs.title: Enhance with TFCE
docs.description: Enhance with TFCE, e.g. -tfce 2 0.5 6 (maybe change 6 to 26 for skeletons)

docs.title: Show support area for voxel
docs.description: Show support area for voxel (X,Y,Z)

docs.title: Replace NaNs
docs.description: Replace NaNs (improper numbers) with 0

docs.title: Make NaN mask
docs.description: Make NaN (improper number) mask with 1 for NaN voxels, 0 otherwise

docs.title: Add uniform noise
docs.description: Add uniform noise (range 0:1)

docs.title: Add Gaussian noise
docs.description: Add Gaussian noise (mean=0 sigma=1)

docs.title: Intensity normalisation
docs.description: Intensity normalisation (per 3D volume mean)

docs.title: Intensity normalisation, global 4D mean
docs.description: Intensity normalisation, global 4D mean

docs.title: Set output calmin/max to full data range
docs.description: Set the output calmin/max to full data range

docs.title: Tensor decomposition
docs.description: Convert a 4D (6-timepoint) tensor image into L1,2,3,FA,MD,MO,V1,2,3 (remaining image in pipeline is FA)

docs.title: 3D kernel
docs.description: 3x3x3 box centered on target voxel (set as default kernel)

docs.title: 2D kernel
docs.description: 3x3x1 box centered on target voxel

docs.title: Box kernel
docs.description: All voxels in a cube of width <size> mm centered on target voxel

docs.title: Box kernel (voxels)
docs.description: All voxels in a cube of width <size> voxels centered on target voxel

docs.title: Box kernel (3D voxels)
docs.description: All voxels in a cuboid of dimensions X x Y x Z centered on target voxel

docs.title: Gaussian kernel
docs.description: Gaussian kernel (sigma in mm, not voxels)

docs.title: Sphere kernel
docs.description: All voxels in a sphere of radius <size> mm centered on target voxel

docs.title: External file kernel
docs.description: Use external file as kernel

docs.title: Mean dilation
docs.description: Mean Dilation of non-zero voxels

docs.title: Modal dilation
docs.description: Modal Dilation of non-zero voxels

docs.title: Maximum filtering
docs.description: Maximum filtering of all voxels

docs.title: Dilate all
docs.description: Apply -dilM repeatedly until the entire FOV is covered

docs.title: Erode
docs.description: Erode by zeroing non-zero voxels when zero voxels found in kernel

docs.title: Minimum filtering
docs.description: Minimum filtering of all voxels

docs.title: Median filtering
docs.description: Median Filtering

docs.title: Mean filtering
docs.description: Mean filtering, kernel weighted (conventionally used with gauss kernel)

docs.title: Mean filtering un-normalised
docs.description: Mean filtering, kernel weighted, un-normalised (gives edge effects)

docs.title: Gaussian kernel filtering
docs.description: Create a gauss kernel of sigma mm and perform mean filtering

docs.title: Downsample by factor of 2
docs.description: Downsamples image by a factor of 2 (keeping new voxels centred on old)

docs.title: Downsample by factor of 2 (non-centred)
docs.description: Downsamples image by a factor of 2 (non-centred)

docs.title: Temporal AR(1) coefficient
docs.description: Temporal AR(1) coefficient (use -odt float and probably demean first)

docs.title: Zero outside ROI
docs.description: <xmin> <xsize> <ymin> <ysize> <zmin> <zsize> <tmin> <tsize>. Zero outside roi (using voxel coordinates). Inputting -1 for a size will set it to the full image extent for that dimension.

docs.description: <lowpass> <highpass>. Bandpass temporal filtering (use -odt float and probably demean first)
